intro: Pycreus sanguinolentus subsp. rubriglumosus, commonly known as the crimson-flowered pycreus, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant red flowers, which bloom in dense, spherical clusters known as umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive silvery underside. This subspecies is noted for its unique coloration and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
